alert.note: Alert for Chickasaw; Fayette; Howard; Winneshiek (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 28 at 8:49PM CST until January 29 at 12:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...SNOW AND TRAVEL IMPACTS CONTINUE... .Snow continues to affect parts of northeast Iowa into southwest Wisconsin this evening. The Advisory has been extended for parts of northeast Iowa until midnight as snow continues to fall. Periods of heavier snowfall rates will continue into the overnight, causing visibilities to drop below a mile at times. Impacts to travel will continue into the overnight. Check road conditions before traveling tonight and drive with caution. A wind chill advisory has been issued for counties in southeastern Minnesota and northeast Iowa where wind chills below -20 degrees are expected into Sunday morning. With these wind chill temperatures, frostbite can occur in 30 minutes or less. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...Howard, Winneshiek, Chickasaw and Fayette Counties. * WHEN...Until midnight CST tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visit 511ia.org for road conditions.
